New Records: Arshdeep Singh conceded 51 runs in the 1st ODI match against New Zealand.
Key Match Events: Arshdeep Singh conceded 27 runs in the final over of the 1st T20I match against New Zealand.
Daryl Mitchell hit Arshdeep Singh for three sixes in the first three balls of the final over.
Washington Sundar was the pick among the bowlers, picking up 2 wickets for just 22 runs from his four overs.
Pre-Game Insights: At the start, India were too full, searching for the swing which was not there and then there were a lot of hit me deliveries.
Post-Match Reflections: Credit to Hardik Pandya to bring finger spin that early in the powerplay which allowed Washington Sundar to grip the ball and extract spin from the surface.
One has to give credit to Daryl Mitchell for New Zealand's late hitting in the game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: India conceded 177 in the 1st T20I in Ranchi.
Arshdeep Singh was guilty of bowling a no-ball in the final over, a trend that has continued from the previous series.
